intro: Scaphyglottis chlorantha, commonly known as the green scaphyglottis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family, specifically within the subfamily Epidendroideae. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are typically broad and elliptical. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The species is noted for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
